meanings.definition: A piece of equipment used to control a horse, consisting of a headstall, bit, and reins.
meanings.sent1: The shiny bridle gleamed in the sunlight as the horse trotted.
meanings.sent2: The rider gently adjusted the bridle to guide the horse along the trail.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to wear the bridle as a fancy necklace.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the bridle that steered her towards success.
meanings.sent5: The bridle jingled softly as the horse nuzzled its owner.

meanings.sent1: She had to bridle her excitement when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The teacher needed to bridle the students' enthusiasm to maintain order.
meanings.sent3: He tried to bridle his laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The captain had to bridle his temper when faced with a difficult decision.
meanings.sent5: She struggled to bridle her impatience while waiting for the results.

meanings.sent1: He could not bridle his frustration when the computer crashed.
meanings.sent2: She tried to bridle her irritation when her brother kept interrupting.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's attempt to bridle his tantrum was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes bridle with annoyance every time he tells that joke.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to bridle her annoyance at the noisy classroom.
